did.abstract: Chiefly Davis' diary (1835, June 6-Oct. 6) relating to plantation business, medical visits, enslaved persons, Methodist preachers and churches, a slave patrol, and the Alston, Massenburg, Slade, Thorne, and Williams families. Also poetry and memoranda mostly from Davis' wife Mary Ann Slade.
